How to Edit a Video 1 Create a new project and import your files. 2 Drag and drop videos, photos, titles, effects and audio onto the timeline. 3 Trim, adjust, and rearrange clips until you're happy with your edit, then produce your video. Or create audio effects with the vocal transformer. What the Community is Saying The software can render videos up to 4k. The rendering speed is awesome. It comes preloaded with many text animations, effects, and transitions. The best part is you can change and play with the settings of the preloaded effects and animations with ease. It's a lot easier to create simple motion graphics and typography compared to its competitors. The learning curve is simpler than most other software that has so many features. There is a whole PowerDirector community and stock library for it's users to access. Love the affordability and ease of use. It has all the bells and whistles of the more expensive competitors yet much more affordable. Great tutorials as well. My favorite things about PowerDirector is how affordable it is and how often then update the software. Its really nice that the company is constantly providing new templates and graphics for the videos every month. We do a LOT of video editing so its really nice to have some variety. "The best enthusiast-level video editor money can buy. " "The best video editing software for Windows and Mac users." "PowerDirector is a program that's suitable for both novices and experienced editors, offering all of the tools you'll need to fine tune your footage at a fairly reasonable price."
